interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: The Swan (Remaster)
Review Date: 2014/12/31
Store: Grace Kelly  (Actor),     Alec Guinness  (Actor),     Charles Vidor  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, MGM Home Entertainment, All MGM Titles
Product Description: ["Grace Kelly is gloriously, glamorously regal in this retelling of Ferenc Molnar's romantic fable about a shy princess whose head tells her to wed a worldly Crown Prince (Alec Guinness), but whose heart is drawn to a dashing commoner (Louis Jourdan). Garbed in dreamy Helen Rose gowns, surrounded by Mittel-European opulence, the leading lady dances, duels, flirts, falls in love and makes even the most jaded moviegoer want to believe in fairy tales. And just to prove that fairy tales can come true, Kelly became a real-life princess as The Swan went into release, marrying Prince Rainier of Monaco in a magnificent royal wedding that captured the world's imagination."]
Average Rating: 4.3

reference_summary:
{'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Simon Langton'], 'Producers': ['Sue Birtwistle', 'Michael Wearing'], 'Starring': ['Alison Steadman', 'Julia Sawalha', 'Colin Firth'], 'Studio': ['Series']}
This is my favorite movie to watch over and over and over.  I have seen most of the other versions of Pride and Prejudice and read the book; but this version is the 'best'.  It follows the book closely.  Every member of the cast is 'perfect.  I never get tired of seeing it again.
I love it.
The Swan (Remaster)

Garbed in dreamy Helen Rose gowns, surrounded by Mittel-European opulence, the leading lady dances, duels, flirts, falls in love and makes even the most jaded moviegoer want to believe in fairy tales. And just to prove that fairy tales can come true, Kelly became a real-life princess as The Swan went into release, marrying Prince Rainier of Monaco in a magnificent royal wedding that captured the world's imagination."]

profile:
**User Profile Summary:**

- **Genre Preference:** Strong affinity for romantic literature adaptations, particularly classic novels, as well as classic films featuring iconic actors.
- **Attributes Valued:** 
  - High-quality storytelling that remains true to the source material.
  - Strong character portrayal and casting, especially in romantic settings.
- **Viewing Habits:** Enjoys rewatching favorite films, indicating a preference for familiar and beloved content over new releases; appreciates classic cinema and performers like Grace Kelly and Alec Guinness.
- **Engagement with Content:** Active participant in discussions around adaptations, showcasing an interest in the narrative elements of storytelling, including comparative analysis of different versions and cinematic retellings.
- **Rating Behavior:** Tends to award high ratings, reflecting a tendency to engage with content that meets personal standards of excellence; recently rated a classic film highly, reinforcing this trend.
- **Language and Accessibility:** Prefers English audio and subtitles, indicating a focus on content that is easily accessible and comprehensible.

Overall, this user exemplifies a passion for adaptations of literary works and classic cinema, with a particular emphasis on quality, familiarity, and faithful representation in film, as well as a deep appreciation for the golden age of Hollywood.
